page.title: 08Folklore 1
page.content: This is the story of the Witch of Kettlebridge. Once, many years ago, there was a young girl of about 19. She was accused of being a witch. She was taken to Thornton Abbey and held there while a cauldron was made which they called a kettle. She was then taken along a tunnel which was said to go from the Abbey to Manor Farm in East Halton.Then she was burnt in the cauldron near a bridge.Before she was burnt she put a curse on the cauldron. Her ashes were taken to Manor Farm to be kept there in the cauldron for ever. It is said that some people did touch the cauldron and nasty things happened to them.It has now been blocked up. There is a variation on this story under Folklore 2.
